meanings.definition: To insert parentheses around words or phrases for clarification.
meanings.sent1: Remember to parenthesize the important information in your essay.
meanings.sent2: It is common to parenthesize numbers in mathematical equations.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to parenthesize the key points in their presentations.
meanings.sent4: She likes to parenthesize her thoughts to make them easier to understand.
meanings.sent5: In order to avoid confusion, always parenthesize the dates in your documents.

meanings.definition: To separate a word or phrase with parentheses for emphasis or to indicate a separate idea.
meanings.sent1: You can parenthesize the examples in your writing to make them stand out.
meanings.sent2: I like to parenthesize the translations of unfamiliar words in my notes.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to parenthesize his jokes with funny asides.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were parenthesized by the laughter of her friends.
meanings.sent5: To highlight the contrast, parenthesize the opposing arguments in your essay.
